wikipedia_page.main: Bill Messer (born 8 July 1915, date of death unknown) was a British cyclist. He competed in the individual and team road race events at the 1936 Summer Olympics.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1936 Summer Olympics

response: On 29 May 1937 he won the 17 mile road race at the Sunday Pictorial Cycling Festival, held at Alexandra Palace in London. In front of 10,000 people and television cameras, and against opposition that included Hubert Opperman, Percy Stallard, Bill Messer, 'Shake' Earnshaw and 'Ernie' Hussey, he broke away on lap 3 of the 11 lap race and survived until the finish.Sunday Pictorial Cycling Festival, 1937
